caption:
This photograph depicts a scene outside a building in Wenatchee, as indicated by the sign above the entrance. The architecture of the building is traditional with red brick walls, large windows, and a symmetrical, slightly enhanced facade featuring cornices and a central apex.

In the foreground, two men are standing on a brick-paved area. One man is donned in a suit and tie with a badge or pin visible on his lapel, looking off to the side somewhat pensively. He carries a satchel and stands with a relaxed, yet formal posture. The other man, positioned slightly behind, is dressed in a dark uniform and cap, likely suggesting a role connected to transportation or security. He is also looking away, holding a small item in one hand.

Adjacent to the building, there is a low fence with potted flowers, adding a decorative and welcoming touch to the building's entrance. The time appears to be during the day, under overcast weather conditions, giving the colors a muted tone. The setting and attire suggest this might be an event of some significance, potentially related to the function or role of the building, but no overt activity is seen besides the quiet standing of the two men.
title: Wenatchee, Washington, train depot. Amtrak passenger trains make 10 minute stops here on runs between Spokane and Seattle. Amtrak is working to Renovate many of the stations in an effort to upgrade facilities and attract increased ridership. The number of rail travelers has increased since the corporation assumed responsibility for most U.S. intercity rail passenger service in 1971.
